result.execSummary:
The defendant Deontez Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
If the defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation (costs and surcharges excluded), Court will grant expungement.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deontez Woods

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Deontez Woods in court with attorney David Herring.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Statements made by parties as to sentencing. Court orders letter from employer and receipt from Cabelas as to the purchase of weapon. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing. Court ordered DNA Sample and surcharge. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Deontez Woods in court with attorney David Herring.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Deontez Woods in court with attorney David Herring.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense received offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deontez Woods in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds that defendant qualifies for representation at county expense.  Court appoints Attorney David Herring.  Telephone call made to Attorney Herring, who accepts the appointment.  Court ordered defendant repay the County at the rate of $50.00 per month upon conclusion of this matter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Counsel signed and filed.  Copy of Order and Complaint to be given to Attorney Herring on next court date.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and  no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Deontez Woods in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Deontez Woods in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
